resources.string: Name of the application.\n{{Identical|Wikipedia}}
Name of the beta version of the application.\n{{Identical|Wikipedia Beta}}
Name of the alpha version of the application.
Wikimedia\'s name.\n{{Identical|Wikimedia}}
Button label for navigating to the previous page.
Back button description when exiting tabs of an article.\n{{Identical|Back}}
Button label for navigating to the next page.
Hint text for the search box
Hint text for the voice input search button
Hint text for the search box.
Hint text for filtering the set of reading lists or pages in a single reading list
Navigation menu item label for suggested edits.\n\n{{Identical|Suggested edits}}
Navigation menu item label for accessing menu items.\n{{identical|More}}
Navigation menu item label for search.
Error message shown when network cannot be reached when loading a page
Text for button that retries page loading when tapped.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for button that retries loading the offline card in the event of an error while loading.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for button that retries when there is an error granting storage access to the app.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for button that retries when there is an error loading an article.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for button that retries when there is an error because of lack of internet connection.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for the back button that goes to the last page visited when tapped.\n{{Identical|Go back}}
Text for suggesting to go back to the previous screen in case of error.\n{{Identical|Go back}}
Text for suggesting to go to the next item in case of error.\n{{Identical|Next}}
Menu item text for clearing your reading history.\n{{Identical|Clear history}}
Message shown when an article is removed from the browsing history. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
Message shown when multiple articles are removed from the browsing history. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.
Button label to undo the operation of deleting an item from the browsing history.\n{{Identical|Undo}}
Button label to undo the operation of archiving a notification.\n{{Identical|Undo}}
Button text to take user to app settings screen
Tooltip text shown when users see the new search tab in the main botton navigation for the first time.
Label text for history items list.
Content description for an image. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the subject.
Title for dialog box asking if you want to clear your reading history.
Message for the dialog box that asks if the user wants to clear their browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.
Affirmative answer to clear the browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to clear the browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.\n{{Identical|No}}

Dialog title text for Share list.

The Share list contains the following menu items (localized):
* Mail
* Message
Text for button to share image via different means.\n{{Identical|Share via}}
Label shown when a search result is redirected from the original search query. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the redirect source.
Text hint for the menu button used for showing the list of current tabs.
Menu item for showing list of languages in which this article is available.\n{{Identical|Change language}}
Menu item for invoking Find in page on current page plus the hint text for the Find in page control
Menu item for adding the current page to the Watchlist.
Menu item text for accessing the article talk page.
Menu item text for accessing the article edit history.
Menu item for removing the current page from the Watchlist.
Menu item for invoking Find in page on a page in edit mode.
Menu item for choosing text size and color scheme
Menu item for adding the current page to a reading list.
Menu item for adding the current page to a default reading list.
Menu item for adding the a card from the feed to a reading list.
Menu item for adding the a card from the feed to a default reading list.
Menu item text for sharing the currently active page. Uses the build-in Android sharing functionality, so translate it the same way as the operating system does.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Menu item text for opening a new tab.
Menu item text for opening a new tab.
>Menu item text for opening the reading lists page.
>Menu item text for opening the history page.
Menu item for opening a link in the current tab.\n{{Identical|Open}}
Menu item for opening a link in a new tab.
Menu item for copying a link to the system clipboard for pasting later.
Menu item caption for launching a dialog containing Wiktionary definitions for the selected text.\n{{Identical|Define}}
Text on button to share the On This Day article.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Text on button to share an article in a reading list.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Menu item caption for editing the current section at the currently highlighted word.
Message in footer of article indicating when the article was last updated. \'%s\' is substituted with the appropriately formatted human-readable timestamp, such as \"seven days ago\".
Link text for accessing Talk pages. Use the same word in your language as is done on the web site, in an action phrase. Some use the term discussions.
Action link text for accessing the edit history for the current article.
Link text for viewing the current article on a map (assuming the article has geo coordinates).
Text indicating that the article is available for the user to read in an another language as well.
Link text that says how many languages the current article is available in. The %d symbol is replaced with the number of languages.
Text of the license CC BY-SA 3.0
HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license before saving edits. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with the actual URLs.

HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license and a login link before saving edits, only when the user has not logged in. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with the actual URLs. Also please do not change the href=\'https://#login\' part of the message.
{{Identical|Search}}
Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, but the current article is not available in any other language

Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, and filtered that list using a search, but their search query does not match any of the other languages the article is available in.
Menu item that shows user list of languages the current article is available in.\n{{Identical|Otherlanguages}}
Section header text that shows user list of languages the current article is available in.
{{Identical|Publish changes}}
Small toast (popup) message saying that the edit was successful
Message for dialog box specifying that an edit save had failed
Button text to retry a failed edit save.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Button text to cancel retrying a failed edit save.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Message for dialog box shown to users when they click on a link in an edit preview, informing them that if they leave the edit then they may lose their changes.
Button text for choosing to leave the edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview.\n{{Identical|Leave}}
Button text for choosing to stay inside edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview.\n{{Identical|Stay}}
Menu item text for showing the Table of Contents for the current article.\n{{Identical|Table of contents}}
Message shown to user when no search results are found for a string
Message shown when there are no pages in the current reading list that match the specified search term. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Message shown when there are no reading lists whose name matches the specified search term.
Message shown when there are no history entries that match the specified search term.
A label for the CAPTCHA screen.
Text informing the user that there is an alternate way to create an account, if in case the user cannot read the captcha, with a link to the page to request an account.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
Call to action. \"Tap\" is imperative verb, \"touch the touchscreen\".
{{Identical|Log in}}
{{Identical|Username}}
{{Identical|Password}}
Text field hint which prompts the user to enter a password in the field.\n{{Identical|Password}}
Hint for a field where the user can enter a two-factor authentication code, if required.
Message for when login fails during an editing workflow because two-factor authentication is required. Directs the user to return to the main activity, log in, and retry.
Text on button suggesting user to login from the onboarding card.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
Text on button suggesting user to login for editing a page.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
Text on button suggesting user to login for syncing reading lists.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
Text on button to login after account creation is complete.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
{{Identical|Log in}}
Used as window title.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
A bubble that describes the in-progress action.
A bubble that appears after logging in.
Title of screen where the user can reset his or her password.
Description shown on the screen where the user resets their password.
Hint shown in the text box where the new password is entered.
Button label for setting a new password and logging in with it.
{{Identical|Log out}}
Toast popup message notifying the user that they have been logged out.\n{{Identical|Logged out}}
Message that asks the user whether they really want to log out.
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for loging out.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Title of dialog box that tells the user they have been logged out.
Dialog box text that tells the user they have been logged out, and asks if they want to log in again.
Button that allows the user to go to the login screen.
Button that cancels the dialog box that tells the user they have been logged out.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Used in \"Browsing history\" page if there is nothing to show.
Brief explanation that there are currently no History entries to look at. Just to fill an empty screen. This usually happens when a user just deleted history entries.
Message shown in a toast when some articles in the history page may not be viewable while offline.
Brief explanation that there are currently no Search entries to look at. Just to fill an empty screen. This usually happens when a user just deleted search entries.
Suggestion text encouraging users to add more languages to the app to read in.
Menu item hint for deleting selected items in a list.

A stylized string saying \"Wikipedia\". Used before wp_tag_line if no image representation exists. Usually the first and last characters are within big tags, if this fits the Wikipedia logo in your language.
{{Identical|Username}}
Label asking the user if they do not yet have an account.
Button label that lets the user create a new account on Wikipedia.
Label asking the user if they have forgotten their password, and will allow them to reset it.
Label asking the user if they already have an account.
{{Identical|Create account}}
Message shown to the user while a request is sent to the server to create an account and the app is awaiting the server response
Label shown inside the email text box in the account creation form, to inform the user what they have to enter into that box.
{{Identical|Repeat password}}
{{Identical|Passwords do not match}}
Used as an error message on creating a user account where the email address the user entered does not appear to be a valid email address.
Used as an error message on logging in or creating a user account where the username entered does not appear to be valid.
Error shown when the password is not valid.
Used as a generic error message during account creation when a more specific error message cannot be given to the user.
Button text on Create Account screen to go \"next\" (to CAPTCHA).\n{{Identical|Next}}
Title to the dialog which recommends the user to enter an email address during account creation.
Dialog message recommending the user to enter an email address during account creation, since it would be useful during account recovery.
Suggestion message recommending the user to enter an email address during account creation, since it would be useful during account recovery.
Action message, to proceed to create an account, without entering an email
Action message, suggesting that the user can enter an email before proceeding to create an account
Button text on Create Account screen to go start creating the account (may also go to a CAPTCHA screen first).\n{{Identical|Create account}}
Error message shown when the selected user name is not available for a new account. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the requested user name.
Message shown if the user\'s IP address is blocked from creating an account.
URL for a page that describes the possible reasons for an IP block, and possible solutions for it.
Button label that shows details that describe an IP address block.
Preferences general heading.\n{{Identical|General}}
Preferences account heading.\n{{Identical|Account}}
Label for a preferences menu link to the FAQ (frequently asked questions) wiki page for the Wikipedia apps for Android and iOS.
Text to show for link used for sending feedback about the app.
Message shown in a small toast when account creation is successful.\n* {{msg-mw|Accountcreatedtext|message}}
Section title for preferences related to syncing
Section title for preferences related to data usage
Section title for experimental settings
Title of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices from this account
Title of preference that, when checked, enables downloading the users\'s reading list articles after syncing.
Description of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices
Description of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices from this account. The %s symbol is replaced with the username if logged in
Title of a warning dialog when turning off the reading list sync. The %s symbol is replaced with the username if logged in
Description of a warning dialog when turning off the reading list sync. The %s symbol is replaced with the username.
Section title for privacy related settings\n{{Identical|Privacy}}
Description of preference that when checked enables data collection of user behavior.
Title of preference that when checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
Description of preference that when checked checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
An error message, which appears after trying to save a page with blacklisted links. The single string parameter %s for this message gets substituted with the blocked domain.
Hint for textbox that searches list of items in browsing history as user types.
Message shown in a toast when the app encounters a link it can not process.
Message shown to users when editing a semi-protected page
Message shown to users when editing a fully protected page
Message shown to users when editing a page that is protected with a custom level of protection. %s refers to the name of the protection level. Examples include \'templateeditor\' on enwiki.
Message in dialog box telling the user that their account does not currently have the sufficient rights to edit this page.
Message in dialog box telling the user that this page is currently protected against anonymous editing.
Title of dialog box telling the user that they can not edit this page because it is protected.
Title of tooltip telling the user that the article can be added to the Watchlist.
Message of tooltip telling the user that the article can be added to the Watchlist.\n\n\"Add to Watchlist\" is {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-menu page add to watchlist}}
Menu item in the nav menu to go to the Settings screen.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Title at the top of the Settings screen.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Summary of the preference item to show the About screen.
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use.\n{{Identical|Privacy policy}}
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use.\n{{Identical|Terms of use}}

URL leading to the About Wikipedia page. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for Czech (lang code \"cs\"): https://cs.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nápověda:Úvod\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works.

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation privacy policy. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://meta.m.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=Privacy_policy/de\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works.
URL leading to the Offline reading and data section of Wikimedia Android app FAQ. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so.
URL leading to the page of Wikimedia Android app FAQ. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so.

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation terms of use. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://foundation.m.wikimedia.org/wiki/Terms_of_Use/de\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works
URL leading to the page of Wikimedia account request. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so
URL for details about the Creative Commons CC BY-SA 3.0 license. When possible, please use the appropriate language-specific URL, and the mobile version of the site.
URL for details about the Creative Commons CC0 license. When possible, please use the appropriate language-specific URL, and the mobile version of the site.
URL leading to the help page for article editing from within the app. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so.\n\n{{optional}}
URL for more information about contributing image tags from the app.
Heading for section that lists the libraries that have been used in the app.
Heading for section that lists the people who have contributed to the app.\n{{Identical|Contributor}}
URL leading to the page of the Wikimedia Android app team. {{doc-important|Please don\'t translate links and link titles.}}
Heading for section that gives credit to translatewiki transators.\n{{Identical|Translator}}
Credit given to translatewiki.net translators.\n\n{{doc-important|Please don\'t translate the link and the site title.}}
Heading for section that describes the license for the app itself.\n{{Identical|License}}
Description of the license for the app, as well as links for finding our source code.\n\n {{doc-important|Please don\'t translate links and link titles.}}
Text and link specifying that this app was developed by the Wikimedia Foundation
{{Identical|About}}
Prompt for the user to abandon any changes that were made during editing.
Affirmative answer to abandon any changes that were made during editing.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to abandon any changes that were made during editing.\n{{Identical|No}}
{{Identical|Blocked}}
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing when they attempt to save an edit
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing based on their IP address
Question that asks the user how they improved the article after editing
Button text in the editing screen to go to the next step - the preview screen.\n{{Identical|Next}}
Button text to finish editing and save the changes.\n{{Identical|Publish}}
Header text to show above the preview of the edited article.\n{{Identical|Preview}}
Button label to undo the previous text that was typed.
Button label to redo the previous text that was typed.
Button label to increase the text size in the editor window.
Button label to decrease the text size in the editor window.
Hint (input field placeholder) for the user to write a custom summary of edits

Title for dialog box that warns the user about \'\'\'an\'\'\' edit conflict.\n\nThis is not the verb \"to edit/modify some conflict\", but the name for a \"conflict occuring while editing/modifying a page and trying to save the changes\".

Message explaining to the user that the edit they are submitting is conflicting with the current state of the article, and instructs the user to go back and reload the page before trying to edit again.
Text for button that finds the next occurrence of a search term.\n{{Identical|Find next}}
Text for button that finds the previous occurrence of a search term
Text that shows up in hint when user tries to get to first occurence when he is already on it.
Text that shows up in hint when user tries to get to last occurence when he is already on it.
Message that notifies the user that the article has been opened in a background tab.
Message that warns the user that their edit may be unconstructive, and asks if they want to continue saving it.
Message that informs the user that their edit is not allowed, and that the user must go back and modify the edit.
Explanation of why the edit may be flagged as unconstructive: Typing in all caps, Blanking articles or Spamming, Irrelevant external links or images, Repeating characters
Explanation of why the edit was not allowed: potentially unconstructive, or potential vandalism.
Button label for showing a list of similar titles (disambiguation) for the current page
Label that gives the user a suggestion for a better search term, instead of the one that the user gave. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the suggestion.
Label at the top of the list of recent searches that the user performed.
Text shown on the list that displays zero counts of the result from the search.

plurals.name: search_results_count
plurals.item: Text shown on the list that displays one count of the result from the search.
Text shown on the list that displays numbers of counts of the result from the search. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the amount of the counts.

resources.string: Button hint for clearing search history; visible when in search mode.
Dialog message that asks if the user really wants to clear the search history.
Affirmative answer to clear the search history.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to clear the search history.\n{{Identical|No}}
Toast message shown when we try to open an external browser but none seems to be installed.
Text shown on the panel which, when tapped, displays the full infobox to the user, therefore exposing a set of information usually composed of factual and short statements.
{{Identical|Meir informasjon}}
{{Identical|Close}}
Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) that displays today\'s featured page.
Text shown inside the widget that tells the user that the link below is today\'s featured page.
Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) for searching Wikipedia\n\nFollowed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.
Message shown when a user requests a definition from Wiktionary but no definition is found.

Title for notification when new alpha update is available.




Followed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.
Text for notification when new alpha update is available.\n\nPreceded by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification title}}.
Button description for the close image button. The text is mainly for screen readers.\n{{Identical|Close}}

Description of the preference for whether images are loaded, mentioning that this setting should be disabled if the user\'s internet connection is slow, or if their data plan is limited or restricted.
Preference title for users to download articles only over Wi-Fi
Title of the dialog that shows the confirmation of downloading articles using mobile data.
Description of the dialog that shows the confirmation of downloading articles using mobile data.
Positive option of the dialog that shows the confirmation of downloading articles using mobile data.\n{{Identical|Allow}}
Title of section that contains information specific to the current article.
Menu label for navigating to the image page for the current image being shown in the gallery.
Error message shown when the current image could not be displayed.
Title for activity displaying the license text for a library that we use. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the library for which the license is being shown.
Label for menu item to share the current image.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Error message shown when there was a problem with sharing the image. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the actual error message from the system.
Message shown when the current media item is being downloaded.
Message shown when the current media item is downloaded successfully.
Error message displayed when a video fails to be played on the device.
Message shown to explain that an extra write permission is needed to save an image.
A label text of adding caption to the image.
A label text of adding caption to the image. The %s is replaced by the language that the caption was used.
Error message when we detect that a file cannot be written to storage.
Title for a button that, when clicked, will expand the list of references or notes at the bottom of a page.
Content description of Creative Commons license logo icon shown before an edit is submitted.
Content description of the actual captcha image the user has to recognize to proceed.
Short name of the Fair Use license when applied to media that do not have attribution information.\n{{Identical|Fair use}}
Text displayed when the uploader of a media item is not known.
Message shown when users tapping on the images in an article while the device is offline.
The label for the action button to dismiss the snackbar.
Text hint for the menu button used for creating a new tab.
Text hint for the menu button used for closing all tabs.
Confirmation message shown when closing all tabs.
Affirmative answer to closing all tabs.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to closing all tabs.\n{{Identical|No}}
Text hint for the button used for closing a tab.
Message shown when an untitled tab is closed.
Message shown when a tab is closed. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the article in the tab.
Message shown when all tabs are closed.
Title for tool-tip that introduces the user to the bookmark icon for saving the article to reading lists.
Very short advice on how the user can click the bookmark icon to save the article to reading lists.
Text for a link that will open the current page in an external browser app on the device.
Title for tool-tip that introduces the user to Table of Contents slider.
Very short advice on how to use Table of Contents slider.\n\n\'\'\'In right to left languages, replace \"left\" with \"right\".\'\'\'
Tool tip text encouraging existing multilingual users to start reading in more languages.
Generic error message that tells the user that the response from the server was not formatted correctly.
Generic error message that tells the user that an unknown error occurred.
Message displayed to the user that shows the actual error response received from the server. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the API onThisDay from the server.\n{{Identical|Message}}
Message shown after copying a link to the system clipboard.
Message shown after copying text to the system clipboard.
Button to continue to the full article from the current link preview.
Button to continue to the talk page that is currently being previewed.
Button to continue to the disambiguation page for the selected title.
Message shown when a selected title refers to more than one page, ending with a colon after which the disambiguations will be listed.
Button text for adding the current page to a reading list.
Message informing the user that an article cannot be loaded while the app is offline. This message is followed by page_offline_notice_add_to_reading_list.

Message inviting the user to add the requested article to a reading list to be downloaded when the app is online. This message follows {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-page_offline_notice_cannot_load_while_offline}}.
Message that tells the user that the current article is loaded from offline storage. The %s symbol is replaced with the date when the article was saved.
Button to obtain directions to the location specified in the link preview.
Error displayed when the device does not have any apps installed that are capable of providing directions to a location.
Title of the preference for customizing the explore feed.
Description of the preference for customizing the explore feed.
Description of the preference for enabling or disabling link previews.
Title of the preference for enabling or disabling automatic collapsing of infoboxes and other tables.
Description of the preference for enabling or disabling automatic collapsing of infoboxes and other tables.
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to a web page where the user may donate to Wikipedia.
Error displayed when the device does not support voice recognition.
Message shown when trying to use location services but they are unavailable
Button label for enabling location services\n{{Identical|Enable}}
Message shown informing the user that if they enable the Location permission, they will be able to see places nearby.
Button label for requesting to turn on location permissions.
Error informing the user that the System WebView is being updated, meaning that the app cannot be launched right now, and that the user should try again in a moment.

plurals.name: multi_items_selected
plurals.item: Toolbar title shown when the user is selecting multiple items in a list, and one item is currently selected.
Toolbar title shown when the user is selecting multiple items in a list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of items currently selected.

resources.string: Toolbar title shown when the user is selecting multiple items in a list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of items currently selected.
Generic message informing the user that an error occurred
Button label for a button to dismiss a link preview\n{{Identical|Dismiss}}
Error message informing the user that the requested page does not exist
{{Doc-mobileapp-internet}}\nError message shown when network cannot be reached when loading a page
Error message shown when a network operation takes too long and times out.
Title shown on the popup dialog for a reference clicked by the user. The %s symbol is replaced with the link text of the clicked reference.
Menu item label for showing the full list of references for the current article.\n{{Identical|Reference}}
Label for a switch on the theme chooser dialog allowing the user to toggle whether images are dimmed in the Dark theme
Title for a preference allowing the user to prefer using cached content over getting the freshest content from the network
Summary for a preference allowing the user to prefer using cached content over getting the freshest content from the network
Label for a switch on the theme chooser dialog allowing the user to match the app theme to system theme.
Text indicating that the article is under a specific license type. The $1 symbol is replaced with a license type.\n{{Identical|Content is available under}}
Label shown on a blank tab with no content.
Label suggesting user to add all open tabs to a list.
Label stating that the current user or IP is blocked.
Label stating which user created the block. The %1$s symbol is replaced by the username of the blocker, and %2$s is replaced by a URL that leads to the user page of the blocker.
Label stating the reason for the block. The %s symbol is replaced by the reason.
Label stating the starting date of the block. The %s symbol is replaced by the date.
Label stating the expiry date of the block. The %s symbol is replaced by the date.
Label stating the ID of the block. The %s symbol is replaced by the ID.

Text that explains how to get in touch with the user or administrator that created the block. The %1$s symbol is replaced by the username of the blocker, and %2$s is replaced by a URL that leads to the user page of the blocker.
Text that explains how to get in touch with an administrator that created the block.
Title of the retry screen displayed when the app crashes.
Message shown to user when the app crashes allowing them to relaunch or quit the app.
Title of button user presses to relaunch the app after it crashes.
Title of button user presses to quit the app after it crashes.\n{{Identical|Quit}}
Button label for saving article to a reading list.\n{{identical|Save}}
Button label for changing the article language.\n{{identical|Language}}
Button label for searching an article.\n{{identical|Search}}
Button label for changing app theme.
Button label for opening the table of content of the article.
Button hint for editing either the lead section or the description of the article.\n{{Identical|Edit}}
Menu label for editing the description of the article.
Menu label for editing the first section of the article.
Label that describes color theme selection\n{{Identical|Theme}}
Button label for Light color theme\n{{Identical|Light}}
Button label for Dark color theme\n{{Identical|Dark}}
Button label for Black color theme
Button label for Sepia color theme
An example header title for previewing color theme changes.
Sample descriptive text giving the user instructions on using the text size slider.
Title for a preference allowing the user to change the color theme of the app
Description for a preference allowing the user to turn on the dark theme
Button hint for increasing the text size used in articles.
Button hint for decreasing the text size used in articles.
Label indicating that the current text size is the default size. The %s symbol is replaced with the percentage of the size.
Label that describes text style selection\n{{Identical|Font}}
Navigation menu item label for reading lists.
Menu item label for saving the current article to a reading list.
Menu item label for moving the current article to a reading list.
Dialog title for creating a new reading list.
Error text shown when a user attempts to create a new list with the same title as an existing list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the title of the existing list.

Message shown to user when an article gets suffessfully added to a readingList.\n\nThe %1$s symbol is replaced with the name of the article and the second %2$s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Message shown to user when an article gets successfully added to a default readingList.\n\nThe %s symbol is replaced with the name of the article.

Message shown to user when an article gets suffessfully moved to a readingList.\n\nThe %1$s symbol is replaced with the name of the article and the second %2$s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.

Message shown to users when they try to add an already existing article to a reading list.The first %1$s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list and the second %2$s symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
Message shown to users when they try to add already existing articles to a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Button label to view the reading list to which the article was just added.
Button label to add the article to a reading list.

plurals.name: format_reading_list_statistical_summary
plurals.item: Summary shown for a reading list that contains one article. The %2$.2f parameter is replaced with the cache size of the article.

Summary shown for a reading list that contains multiple articles; The %1$d parameter is the number of pages in the list, and the %2$.2f parameter is the total number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

plurals.name: format_reading_list_statistical_detail
plurals.item: Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains one article; The %1$d parameter is the number pages saved to disk for offline reading (zero or one), and the %3$.2f parameter is the number of megabytes saved to disk for this list.

Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains multiple articles; The %1$d parameter is the number of pages saved to disk for offline reading, the %2$d parameter is the number of total pages in the list, and the %3$.2f parameter is the total number of megabytes saved to disk for this list.

resources.string: Summary shown for a reading list that contains one article (singular); this string is formatted with a parameter containing the number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading. The %1$.2f symbol is replaced with the cache size of the article.

Summary shown for a reading list that contains zero or multiple articles (plural); this string is formatted with two arguments: 1)(%1$d) the number of pages in the list, 2)(%2$.2f) a parameter containing the total number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains one article (singular); this string is formatted with two arguments: 1)(%1$d) the number, zero or one, of pages saved to disk for offline reading, 2)(%2$.2f) a parameter containing the number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains zero or multiple articles (plural); this string is formatted with three arguments: 1)(%1$d) the number of pages saved to disk for offline reading, 2)(%2$d) the number of pages in the list total, 3)(%3$.2f) a parameter containing the total number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.
Button label to sort reading lists.\n{{Identical|Sort}}
Menu option suggesting that the user can sort the reading listsin many ways.
Menu option to sort reading lists by name.
Menu option to sort reading lists by name, in reverse order.
Menu option to sort reading lists from newest to oldest, based on the date the items were added.
Menu option to sort reading lists from oldest to newest, based on the date the items were added.
Menu option to sort reading lists from newest to oldest, based on the date the items were created.
Menu option to sort reading lists from oldest to newest, based on the date the items were created.
Button label to delete the current reading list.
Menu item for changing the name and description of a reading list.
Label for a menu option allowing the user to remove selected articles from offline storage
Label for a menu option allowing the user to save article content for offline availability
Label for a menu option allowing the user to remove all articles in a reading list from offline storage
Label for a menu option allowing the user to save all articles in a reading list for offline availability
Label for a menu option allowing the user to add the selected articles to another reading list
Label for a menu option allowing the user to move the selected articles to another reading list
Default name for a new reading list.
Text input hint for entering the name of this reading list.
Text input hint for entering a description of this reading list. Mention that the description is optional.
Message shown when an article is removed from a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
Message shown when an article is removed from a reading list. The \"%1$s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the article.The \"%2$s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the list.

plurals.name: reading_list_articles_deleted
plurals.item: Message shown when one article is removed from a reading list.
Message shown when multiple articles are removed from a reading list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.

plurals.name: reading_list_articles_deleted_from_list
plurals.item: Message shown when one article is removed from a reading list.The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the reading list name.
Message shown when multiple articles are removed from a reading list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the reading list name.

resources.string: Message shown when multiple articles are removed from a reading list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.
Menu item to remove an article from selected reading lists. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
Button label to undo the operation of deleting an item from a list.\n{{Identical|Undo}}
Message shown when a reading list is deleted. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the list.
Title message shown when there are no articles in saved list.
Descriptive message that explains the benefits of reading lists, and the location of the button to add an article to a reading list.
Message shown when a reading list does not contain any articles.
Label for a toggle switch to make a reading list article available offline or online.
Hint for button that makes a reading list article available for offline use.
Menu item to add an article to another reading list (when the article already exists in one or more lists).
Menu item to move an article to another reading list (when the article already exists in one or more lists).
Menu item to move an article from a specific reading list to another reading list. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Menu item to remove an article from a specific reading list. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Menu item to remove an article from multiple reading lists to which it might belong.
Menu item to select an article for further multiple delete action.
Label for a dialog button confirming that the user wants to remove the selected list from offline availability for all reading lists.
Title for a dialog warning the user that the page the user has selected to remove from offline availability appears in multiple lists.

Message for a dialog warning the user that the page the user has selected to remove from offline availability appears in multiple lists. The names of the lists appear below. The \"%s\" symbol is the title of the page of the user selected to remove.
Title for a tutorial card that reminds the user that their reading lists can be synchronized.
Text for a tutorial card that reminds the user that their reading lists can be synchronized, with a link to the synced reading lists FAQ page that explains the procedure in detail.
Text for a tutorial card that reminds the user that logging in will enable syncing of reading lists, with a link to the synced reading lists FAQ page that explains the procedure in detail.
Button text for turning on synchronizing of reading lists.
Title for a tutorial card that reminds the user that logging in will enable syncing of reading lists.
Text for a tutorial card that reminds the user that logging in will enable syncing of reading lists.
Button text of the encourage account creation card log in button.
Button text of dismissing the encourage account creation card button.
Affirmative answer to confirm that remotely stored reading list data used for syncing across devices should be deleted.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to confirm that remotely stored reading list data used for syncing across devices should be deleted.\n{{Identical|No}}
Message shown when the article is in the process of being downloaded, and is not yet available for offline access.
Message shown when the user adds articles to a named reading list. The %1$d symbol is replaced with the number of articles added, and the %2$s symbol is replaced with the list name.
Message shown when the user moves articles to a named reading list. The %1$d symbol is replaced with the number of articles moved, and the %2$s symbol is replaced with the list name.
Confirmation message shown when deleting a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the list.
Title of warning message shown to a user to login for enabling syncing of reading lists.
Warning message shown to a user to login for enabling syncing of reading lists.
Negative answer to cancel the current process.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the login page.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
Title of warning message shown to a user when the user turns OFF syncing on one of their devices.
Warning message shown to a user when the user turns OFF syncing on one of their devices.\n\n\"Settings\" is {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-settings item preferences}}.
Negative answer to dismiss the dialog.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the settings page.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Title of warning message shown to a user who is logged in who has not opted-in to syncing enters this screen at the first time.

Warning message shown to a user who is logged in who has not opted in to syncing enters this screen at the first time, also contains a link to MediaWiki FAQ page. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form.)
An option shows on dialog that does not allow to receive the message again.
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the settings page.
Negative answer to dismiss the dialog.\n{{Identical|No thanks}}
Title for default list
Short description of the default reading list where articles are saved.
Suggestion string for users to Organize articles into lists
Text explaining the advantages of creating reading lists, to users
\"%1$s\" _[string indicating that the list was created by user]

Message shown to users with large reading lists, informing them that this update will enforce a limit on the number of articles per list and hence will be splitting already existing lists that contain more than the limit. The %d symbol is replaced with the maximum number of articles per list.

Message shown to the users when the limit for maximum number of articles in a list is reached, denoted by the \"%2$d\" symbol, informing them that they will not be able to move the article to that list, named \"%1$s\".

Message shown to the users when the limit for maximum number of articles in a list is reached, denoted by the \"%2$d\" symbol, informing them that they will not be able to add anymore to that list, named \"%1$s\".
Message shown to the users when the limit for maimum number of reading lists is reached, informing them that they will not be able to create anymore lists
Menu option offering user an option to create a new reading list.
Heading for a list of suggested sort options.\n{{Identical|Sort by}}
Menu option suggesting that the user can manually sync using this option.

plurals.name: reading_list_article_offline_message
plurals.item: Message shown when a single reading list article is made available for offline use.
Message shown when more than one reading list article is made available for offline use.

plurals.name: reading_list_article_not_offline_message
plurals.item: Message shown when a single reading list article is removed from offline availability.
Message shown when more than one reading list article is removed from offline availability.

resources.string: Message informing the user that their reading lists were synced successfully.
Message informing the user that their reading lists were synced successfully. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the last synced time.
Positive action button text in pop-up dialog for removing article from list.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Positive action button text in pop-up dialog for deleting a list.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for removing article from a list.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for deleting a list.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for removing article from offline storage.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for downloading content on mobile data connection.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Positive action button text in warning pop-up dialog for splitting large reading lists.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Checkbox title for Wikimedia account preference synchronization.\n{{Identical|Preferences}}
Title for notification when an edit made by the user is reverted.
Title of the notification channel
Description of the notification channel
Text of button on notification bar to pause the syncing process\n{{Identical|Pause}}
Text of button on notification bar to resume the syncing process
Text of button on notification bar to cancel the syncing process\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Title of the notification channel of syncing reading lists
Description of the notification channel of syncing reading lists
Message telling the user that they have multiple unread notifications. The %d symbol is replaced with the number of notifications.

plurals.name: notification_channel_name
plurals.item: Name of the notification channel that shows the app is downloading one article
Name of the notification channel that shows the app is downloading two or more articles

plurals.name: notification_syncing_title
plurals.item: Title for notification when the downloading process of one article begins. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of articles.
Title for notification when the downloading process of two or more article begins. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of articles.

plurals.name: notification_syncing_description
plurals.item: Text of notification shows the remaining article. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of remaining articles.
Text of notification shows the remaining articles. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of remaining articles.

plurals.name: notification_syncing_reading_list_channel_name
plurals.item: Name of the notification channel of syncing one reading list
Name of the notification channel of syncing two or more reading lists

plurals.name: notification_syncing_reading_list_title
plurals.item: Title for notification when the syncing one reading list process begins. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of lists.
Title for notification when the syncing two or more reading lists process begins. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of lists.

plurals.name: notification_syncing_reading_list_description
plurals.item: Text of notification shows the remaining list. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of remaining lists.
Text of notification shows the remaining lists. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of remaining lists.

resources.string: Description for the notification channel that will show Echo notifications.
Title for the activity where the list of notifications for the current user is shown.
Title for the activity where the list of archived notifications for the current user is shown.
Menu label for searching through the notifications for the current user.
Menu label for viewing unread notifications.
Menu label for viewing archived (read) notifications.
Menu label for navigating to the preferences for showing notifications in the app.
Menu label for marking the current notification as read, and archiving it.

plurals.name: notification_archive_message
plurals.item: Message shown when a single notification is archived.
Message shown when multiple notifications are archived. The %d is replaced with the number of notifications.

resources.string: Title of alert dialog asking the user to enable polling of notifications.
Positive response for enabling polling of notifications.
Negative response for enabling polling of notifications.
Message shown when the user has no new notifications.
Button label for navigating to the list of archived notifications.
Title of activity where the notification preferences are managed.
Menu label for marking the selected notifications as unread.
Menu label for marking all notifications as read.
Button label for creating a direct reply to a message.
Label for message indicating that a reply is being posted. The %s symbol is replaced with the username to whom the reply is made.
Message shown when a reply was posted successfully.
Message shown when there was an error while posting a reply.
Title of screen that contains the watchlist for the current user.

Label for settings switch that enables or disables polling of new notifications.\n\n{{doc-important|\"Poll\" is a verb here. This is about the polling of notifications, not about notifications of polls.}}
Short summary explaining what polling of notification means.
Label for the settings category that contains the types of notifications that are shown in the app.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables System notifications.
Short summary explaining what System notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Milestone notifications.
Short summary explaining what Milestone notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Thanks notifications.
Short summary explaining what Thanks notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Revert notifications.
Short summary explaining what Revert notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Login notifications.
Short summary explaining what Login notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Mention notifications.
Short summary explaining what Mention notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables User talk notifications.
Short summary explaining what User talk notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Email received notifications.
Short summary explaining what Email received notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables User rights change notifications.
Short summary explaining what User rights change notifications are.
Label for settings switch that enables or disables Links to articles you created notifications.
Short summary explaining what Links to articles you created notifications are.
Label for the push notifications settings category.
Label that leads user to the system notifications settings page.
>Label for the notification display settings category.
Label for settings switch that shows or hides the read notifications.
Title for the Wikipedia notifications group.
Description for the Wikipedia notifications group.
Title for the other notifications group.
Description for the other notifications group.
Label for card in the feed that gives the user reading suggestions based on an article from their browsing history.
Title of a card that the user can click to view a randomly selected Wikipedia article
Title of a card that the user can click to view a randomly selected Wikipedia article
Label of a action button that leads the user to the Randomizer page.
Feed card title for recently popular articles.\n{{Identical|Top read}}
Button label to navigate to a full-screen view containing more trending articles.
Text for showing the amount of pageviews in thousands. \"%d\" represents the number of pageviews in thousands.
Text for showing the amount of pageviews in millions. \"%d\" represents the number of pageviews in millions.
Button hint for loading another random article.
Title of a card that the user can click to view the main page of the Wikipedia project for the current app language.
Button label for navigating to the Main Page of Wikipedia.
Title of a card showing the Picture of the Day from Wikimedia Commons.
Label for a button the user can click to download the full-size Picture of the Day.\n{{Identical|Download}}
Label for a button the user can click to share the image link of the Picture of the Day.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Menu item used for hiding a certain item in the list of feed cards.
Message to inform the user that the selected item has been hidden.
Menu item used for opening the page of editing card languages
Label for toolbar menu item that shows the user more options, such as logging in and accessing the app settings.
Text included as the subject when a user shares an image from the Today\'s Featured Image feed card.
Menu item label for exploring Wikipedia content through Feed cards.\n{{Identical|Explore}}
Menu item label for going to the home screen in the app.
Feed card icon description for use when the icon cannot be seen and acessibility.
Feed card title for news articles.

plurals.name: view_continue_reading_card_subtitle
plurals.item: Subtitle for a day old \"continue reading\" card. The word should be in lowercase if appropriate for the language.

Subtitle for a \"continue reading\" card two or more days old. The first word should have an initial uppercase letter if appropriate for the language. Example: [[phab:F4695814]]. Use the %d parameter to insert the number of days passed since the content (an article) was last seen.

resources.string: Shown on cards in the feed when the card has today\'s date. The word should be in lowercase if appropriate for the language.\n{{Identical|Today}}

Subtitle for number of days passed since the article was last seen and shown on cards in the feed. Use the %s parameter to insert the number of days passed since the content (an article) was last seen.\n\nThe word \"read\" is either past tense, as in \"(you have) read (this) 4 days ago\", or a participle as in \"(this was) read (by you) 4 days ago\".
Button label that allows the user to decline the action that this card is requesting.\n{{Identical|No thanks}}
Message in the feed informing the user that additional content cannot be loaded while offline.
Title shown in the Featured Article card in the Explore feed
Text on button that indicates user can save article to reading lists.\n{{Identical|Save}}
Title shown at the top of the screen where the user customizes which cards are shown in the Explore feed.
Menu label for resetting the customization of the Explore feed cards to the original defaults.
Menu label for showing all types of Explore feed cards.
Menu label for hiding all types of Explore feed cards.
Message that warns the user that various types of Explore feed content might not be available in all selected languages.
Short description for Explore feed card that contains daily news items
Short description for Explore feed card that contains events that occurred on this day in history
Short description for Explore feed card that contains suggestions based on the browsing history of the user
Short description for Explore feed card that contains the daily featured article
Short description for Explore feed card that contains daily trending articles
Short description for Explore feed card that contains the daily featured image from Commons
Short description for Explore feed card that contains a link to the Main Page
Short description for Explore feed card that generates random articles
Short description for Explore feed card that suggests articles for adding or translating descriptions
Message informing the user that their Explore feed is currently empty.
Button label for onboarding card that introduces the customization of the Explore feed.
Positive action button text in pop-up dialog for card language selection in customization screen.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for card language selection in customization screen.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Onboarding text that describes the new functionality of customizing the Explore feed.
Positive action button text in pop-up dialog for feed card language selection.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for feed card language selection.
Short description for the accessibility card that tells user it is the bottom of the explore feed.
Button lable for manually loading more cards to the explore feed.
Title for the screen with all top read links. \"%s\" represents the date string
Hint text that is shown when the article description field is empty.
Label that prompts the user that the summary of the article shows under the label.\n{{Identical|Article}}
Label that prompts the user that the summary of the article shows under the label. %s represents the language of the description.
Hint text that is shown when the description field is empty. %s represents the language of the description.
Label that prompts the user that the caption of the image shows under the label.
Hint text that is shown when the image caption field is empty.
Label that prompts the user that the summary of the article shows under the label. %s represents the language of the caption.
Hint text that is shown when the image caption field is empty. %s represents the language of the caption.
Hint for the button that is pressed for saving the new description.\n{{Identical|Publish}}
Label that prompts the user to click and open a preview dialog of the article.\n{{Identical|Read}}
Label that prompts the user to add a article description to an article that does not yet have one.
Label that prompts the user to translate a article description to an article that does not yet have a description.
Label that prompts the user to edit the description of an article that already has one.
Label that prompts the user to add the caption of an image that does not yet have one.
Label that prompts the user to edit the caption of an image that already has one.
Label that prompts the user to translate a caption to an image that does not yet have a caption.
Hint for button that cancels editing of the current description.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Title at the top of the screen that shows additional help and information about editing descriptions.
Menu label for navigating to a page describing Wikidata.
Menu label for navigating to the official Wikidata guide for composing descriptions.
URL that points to a page on Wikidata that contains guidelines for writing descriptions. Preferably the URL should link directly to the section that lists specific guidelines.
Dialog message that informs the user that they must log in before making edits to additional descriptions.
Disclaimer that specifies the Terms of Use and CC license that applies to editing descriptions. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with URLs.
Warning message shows the article description usually begin with a lowercase letter.
Content description for the voice input icon in the input field
Error text shown when a description is too short.
Error text shown when a description ends with punctuation.

{{Optional}}\n\nWarning text shown when a description starts with a definite or indefinite article. Currently implemented in English, German, Spanish, and French. Doesn\'t need translation to other languages. When translating, use the articles in the language and don\'t copy the English ones.
Warning text shown when a description starts with an uppercase character.
Warning text shown when a description starts with a lowercase character.
Warning message shown to users when their editing language is different form their keyboard language.%s represents the expected language.
Message that the article description the user just added was saved.
Message shown on a snackbar that the article description the user just added was saved.
Message shown on a snackbar that the article description the user just added was saved. The %s symbol is replaced by the language that the caption was used.
Message shown on a snackbar that the image caption the user just added was saved.
Message shown on a snackbar that the image caption the user just added was saved. The %s symbol is replaced by the language that the caption was used.
Message shown on a snackbar that the image tags the user just added were saved.
Message shown on a snackbar that leads the user to the specific Suggested edits feed.
Message that the user made Wikipedia better for everyone
Button text to dismiss the description editing success screen\n{{Identical|Done}}
Heading for a tip about editing articles in the app\n{{Identical|Did you know}}
A message informing the user about how to edit articles in the app. The \"^1\" symbol is replaced with an edit pencil icon.
Heading for a tutorial about editing page article descriptions.
Summary of what page title descriptions are for.
An instruction for the user to keep descriptions short.
Instructions for the description the user creates to be one line only and between two to twelve words.
Label for a button the user can push when ready to start editing.
A statement that the user promises not to misuse the feature.
Title of screen where the user chooses articles that are missing article descriptions to be described.
Title of screen where the user chooses images that are missing captions to be captioned.
Title of screen where the user chooses tags that represent an image.
Title of the review article description page.
A button text for adding article description. Appears next to {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-onboarding skip}}. (See also [https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T214786 bug T214786].)
A button text for editing article description.
A button text for adding a translation of article description.
A button text for editing a translation of article description.
A button text for adding image caption.
A button text for editing image caption.
Title of the review image caption page.
A overflow menu text that leads to my contributions page
A label shows that the current image does not have description.
Disclaimer that specifies the Terms of Use and CC license that applies to add descriptions. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with URLs.
Disclaimer that specifies the Terms of Use and CC license that applies to add image captions. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with URLs.
Suggested edits menu label for accessing the editing FAQ.\n{{Identical|Info}}
Article description task heading.
Article description task explanation given to user.
Image caption tasks heading.
Image caption tasks explanation given to user.
Image caption translation tasks heading.
Image caption translation tasks explanation given to user.
Multilingual tasks heading.
Multilingual tasks explantion given to user.
Hint message to users about why the caption tasks are locked and how they can be unlocked by making valid edits. %d is the number of edits.
Hint message to users about why the translation tasks are locked and how they can be unlocked by making valid edits. %d is the number of edits.
Negative action button text for editing tasks.
Positive action button text for editing tasks.
Label to show the artifact type shown in suggested edit card
Artist title text of the file summary shown in suggested edit card.
Author title text of the file summary shown in suggested edit card.\n{{Identical|Author}}
Source title text of the file summary shown in suggested edit card.
License title text of the file summary shown in suggested edit card.\n{{Identical|Licence}}
Date title text of the file summary shown in suggested edit card.\n{{Identical|Date}}

plurals.name: suggested_edits_contribution_count
plurals.item: Text suggesting that one in-app contribution was made.
Text suggesting that two or more in-app contributions were made. %d is the number of contribution.

resources.string: Title text for suggested edits card in the explore feed.\n\n{{Identical|Suggested edits}}
Suggested edits feed card call-to-action text for adding article descriptions.
Button label to add article description in certain language. The %s is replaced by the language that the description is used.
Text on button to start tasks from edit action feed.\n{{Identical|Get started}}
Label for image caption detail on image details screen. The %s is replaced by the language that the caption is used.
Label for image file name on image details screen.
Label for a file that originates from Wikimedia Commons.
Label for image artist detail on image details screen.
Label for image tags detail on image details screen.
Label for image date detail on image details screen.
Label for image source detail on image details screen.
Label for image licensing detail on image details screen.
Label for link to more details about the image on commons page.
Text for link to more details about the image on commons page.
Text for link to more details about the image on Wikipedia page.
Text for call to action button on article lead image, prompting the user to add tags to the lead image.
Text for call to action button on article lead image, prompting the user to add a caption in the current app language.
Text for call to action button on article lead image, prompting the user to add a caption in the %s language.
Button text suggesting the user to view the image
Suggested edits feed card call-to-action text for adding image captions
Suggested edits feed card call-to-action text for translating image captions. %s represents the language into which the image caption needs to be translated
Suggested edits feed card call-to-action text for adding image depicts.
One-time text shown to users when they submit a successful suggested edit, requesting them to take a survey.
Button label on the snackbar shown to users when they submit a successful suggested edit, requesting them to take a survey.
Button label for suggested edits task add action
Button label for suggested edits task translate action
Suggested Edits image captions task title
Suggested Edits image tags task title
Status when the selected image tags are being published.
Status when the selected image tags have been published.
Title shown on the onboarding screen for adding tags to images.
Body text of the onboarding screen for adding tags to images.
Footnote shown on the onboarding screen for adding tags to images.
Explanation for the task of adding tags to images.
Short text asking the user to choose the tags that match the image.
Title for list of tags that have been published.
Hint for text field used for searching image tags.
Title for a dialog box informing the user that they have not selected any tags for the current image.
Text for a dialog box asking the user whether they are sure about rejecting all of the suggested tags for the current image.
Label text suggesting that user can add custom tags.
Short message telling the user that they can pinch to zoom the image that is shown.
Message text shown to users to encourage them to continue and increase editing.%s represents the user\'s name.
Message text shown to users who havent yet used the suggested edits features, to encourage them to start editing.%s represents the user\'s name
Image captions detail text explaining the task of adding image captions.
Article descriptions detail text explaining the task of adding article descriptions.
Tool tip text explaining the contributions statistics to the user.\n\n\"Suggested edits\" should be translated the same as {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-suggested edits tasks activity title}}.
Tool tip text explaining the edit streak statistics to the user.\n\n\"Suggested edits\" should be translated the same as {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-suggested edits tasks activity title}}.
Tool tip text explaining the page views statistics to the user.\n\n\"Suggested edits\" should be translated the same as {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-suggested edits tasks activity title}}.
Tool tip text explaining the edit quality statistics to the user. %d represents the number of reverts.

Text explaining the reason for a short term disabling of editing previleges to the user. The %1$s symbol will be replaced by the date when editing will be unlocked again, and the %2$s symbol represents the user\'s name.
Text explaining the reason for disabling of editing previleges to the user. %s represents the user\'s name.
Text explaining ip blocking to the user.
Label text for editing tips and tricks
Label text for suggested edits help page
Suggested edits label text for edit streak
Suggested edits label text for pageviews
Suggested edits label text for edit quality
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is perfect
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is excellent
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is very good
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is good
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is okay
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is sufficient
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is poor
Suggested edits label text indicating that the edit quality of the user is bad
Label text for suggested edits.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_contribution
plurals.item: Label text for indicating how many contributions a user has made. For One contribution.
Label text for indicating how many contributions a user has made. For many contributions.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_edit_streak_detail_text
plurals.item: Label text to show the length of the edit streak in number of days. %d is for one dat.
Label text to show the length of the edit streak in number of days. %d is for many days

resources.string: Title for card that introduces Suggested edits.
Body text for card that introduces Suggested edits.
Button text for navigating to additional information for the user.
Title for card that explains that this feature is currently paused.
Title for card that explains that this feature is currently disabled.
Title for card that explains that the IP address of the user is blocked.
This refers to the date when the user made their last edit.
Displayed when the user has never made an edit.

Quick label shown for tasks that are newly introduced (should be lowercase in languages that support it).\n\nShould be translated as a kind of advertising, referring to somthing like a \"new (feature)\" or a \"new (thing)\".
Disclaimer that specifies the Terms of Use and CC license that applies to publishing these types of edits. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with URLs.
Title of notification when the user has not edited for days.
Text of notification when the user has not edited for days (first stage).
Text of notification when the user has not edited for days (second stage).
Contributions screen title text. The %s symbol is replaced with the username.
Text label indicating that the associated data indicates the language of the user contribution.\n{{identical|Language}}
Text label indicating that the associated data indicates the date and time of the user contribution.
Text label indicating that the associated data indicates the type of the user contribution.
Text label that indicates that the contribution is to an image file.\n{{identical|File}}
Text label that indicates that the contribution is to an article.\n{{identical|Article}}
Text label indicating that the associated data indicates the number of views that the contribution has. %s represents the type of contribution.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_contribution_seen_times
plurals.item: Indicates that the contributions have been seen once in the past 30 days.
Indicates how many times the contributions have been viewed in the past 30 days. The %s parameter is replaced by the number of views.

resources.string: Contribution detail text about the pageviews. %s represented the times the contribution has been viewed in the past 30 days.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_image_tag_contribution_label
plurals.item: Text summarizing the user\'s image tag contribution. %d represents the number of tags contributed.
Text summarizing the user\'s image tag contribution. %d represents the number of tags contributed.

resources.string: Dropdown selection for filtering different types of edits made by the user. %1$d represents the number of edits of a certain type, and %2$s represents the type of edit, which can include Descriptions, Captions, or general Contributions.
Text for contributions date to indicate it was contributed yesterday
Title text of the encourage account creation card.
Content text of the encourage account creation card.
Button text of the encourage account creation card log in button.
Text indicating that the user edit was an Image tag edit
Text indicating that the user\'s edit was the most recent one on a given image or article
Label text for SE feed card footer action.
Label text indicating the number of tags added or removed by a user contribution. %1$s represents the number.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_contribution_diff_count_text
plurals.item: Label text indicating the number of characters added or removed by a user contribution. %1$s represents the number.
Label text indicating the number of characters added or removed by a user contribution. %1$s represents the number.

resources.string: Text summarizing the user\'s contribution to the article or image. %d represents the number when many characters are removed by the contribution.

plurals.name: suggested_edits_added_contribution_label
plurals.item: Text summarizing the user\'s contribution to the article or image. %d represents the number when only one character is added.
Text summarizing the user\'s contribution to the article or image. %d represents the number when many characters are added.

resources.string: Title shown at the top of the activity for the file page.
Button label to add image caption for the file.
Button label to add image tags for the file.
Suggestion reason title text of the file summary shown in the file page.
Subtitle in the dialog that informs the user that their edit was reverted.
Introduction message informing the user that their edit was reverted, and leading into possible reasons for the revert.
Reason for an edit being reverted, because it did not follow the guidelines for descriptions. (Please preserve the anchor tag and formatted symbol (%1$s) in its exact form)
Reason for an edit being reverted, because it looks like vandalism.
Message that allows the user to go to the edit history associated with the article. (Please preserve the anchor tag %1$s in its exact form)
Negative action button text in pop-up dialog for loging in for editing.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Message explaining why we need permission to access the device storage when reading articles in offline mode.
Message explaining why we need permission to access the device storage when reading articles in offline mode.
Label for showing size in GB. The %.2f is replaced by the number in gigabytes(GB)
Label for showing size in MB. The %.2f is replaced by the number in megabytes (MB)
Button label to continue to the next onboarding or tutorial screen.\n{{Identical|Continue}}
Button label to finish the current onboarding or tutorial workflow.\n{{Identical|Get started}}
Button label to dismiss the current onboarding or tutorial screen without any further action.
Title for a tutorial screen about the Explore feed.
Title for a tutorial screen about synchronizing reading lists.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of synchronizing reading lists. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Title for a tutorial screen about anonymous usage reports sent by the app.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of allowing the app to send anonymous usage reports. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Label for an on-off switch that enables sending anonymous usage reports.
Button label for dismissing the current onboarding card.\n{{Identical|Got it}}
Onboarding subtitle text informing the user about the languages found on the device.
Button text to suggest that users can now add more languages of their preference.
